text:
On make check for APR 1.3.6 and 1.3.7 I see:
--8<---
testoc              : SUCCESS
testpath            : SUCCESS
testpipe            : |Programs failed: testall
make[1]: *** [check] Error 141
make[1]: Leaving directory `/home/rhys/tmp/apr-1.3.7/test'
make: *** [check] Error 2
--8<---
This occurs on Ubuntu 9.04 / 32-bit and Ubuntu 8.04 / 64-bit, both with Intel 10.1 compilers requiring entries in LD_LIBRARY_PATH.

- Rhys
creator: rhys.ulerich@gmail.com

text:
Created attachment 24084
Patch to add environment to the child
creator: bojan@rexursive.com

text: Does the attached patch work for you?
creator: bojan@rexursive.com

text:
I've committed this to trunk, 1.4.x and 1.3.x, hoping it will help (I don't see it causing harm anyway).

This patch will be included in APR 1.3.8, so please test there and let us know if it does anything.
creator: bojan@rexursive.com
rhys.ulerich@gmail.com
text:
Using the 1.3.8 release on Ubuntu 9.04 / 32-bit with Intel compilers I see
---8<---
testpoll            : SUCCESS
testpools           : SUCCESS
testproc            : |proc_child: error while loading shared libraries: libimf.so: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory                  FAILED 2 of 3
testprocmutex       : SUCCESS
testrand            : SUCCESS
testsleep           : SUCCESS
testshm             : -testshmconsumer: error while loading shared libraries: libimf.so: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory             \testshmproducer: error while loading shared libraries: libimf.so: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory                                    SUCCESS
testsock            : -sockchild: error while loading shared libraries: libimf.so: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
---8<---

libimf.so is in my LD_LIBRARY_PATH.  Sorry for the delay.  I was on holiday.
OK, thanks for the info. I'll have a look - there could be other instances that have a similar issue (i.e. no environment).
creator: bojan@rexursive.com

text:
Created attachment 24196
Add copy environment to attributes
creator: bojan@rexursive.com

text: Could you please test with the patch I just attached. Thanks.
creator: bojan@rexursive.com

text:
This patch looks good applied atop 1.3.8-- make check passes when using Intel compilers requiring an appropriately set LD_LIBRARY_PATH.

Thanks!

- Rhys
creator: rhys.ulerich@gmail.com

text:
OK, thanks for testing.

Committed to trunk, 1.4.x and 1.3.x. Unless the patch caused some unplanned breakage, I think we should be good.
creator: bojan@rexursive.com
